intro: Scorzonera coronopifolia var. asphodeloides, commonly known as the asphodel-like scorzonera, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It features a rosette of gray-green, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. The plant produces tall, branched stems that bear yellow, daisy-like flowers with ray florets. Its root system is fibrous and often contains a tuber-like structure, which is sometimes used in traditional medicine. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
